Job Description:
Activate Interactive Pte Ltd (“Activate”) is a leading technology consultancy headquartered in Singapore with a presence in Malaysia and Indonesia. Our clients are empowered with quality, cost-effective, and impactful end-to-end application development, like mobile and web applications, and cloud technology that remove technology roadblocks and increase their business efficiency.
We believe in positively impacting the lives of people around us and the environment we live in through the use of technology. Hence, we are committed to providing a conducive environment for all employees to realise their full potential, who in turn have the opportunity to continuously drive innovation.
We are searching for our next team members to join our growing team.
If you love the idea of being part of a growing company with exciting prospects in mobile and web technologies that create positive impact on people’s lives, then we would love to hear from you.
Co-Development Business Unit is looking for Senior DevOps Engineer
We aims to spearhead the digital transformation of government. We are a team that aims to design and develop software applications that help government agencies better serve the needs of Singaporeans. We adopt an Agile development approach and work towards adopting tech best practices and cutting edge tools.
We are seeking highly motivated individuals skilled in DevOps to join us for some exciting projects. You’ll work with a multidisciplinary team of designers, developers and business experts to create solutions that exist in both digital and physical realms.
As we launch new products, your role will be to ensure that the future of public service is not just functional, but delightful to use. Rather than work on commercial ventures commonly found in the startup scene, we're here to improve how we live as a society through what we can offer as a government.
What will you do?
Manage the development of the internal engineering productivity tools and environments.
Providing DevOps architecture implementation and operational support
Architecture and planning for cloud deployments (Private and Public cloud)
Be an innovative and hands-on DevOps engineer capable of looking at both thetechnology and strategy around the platform.
Future-proofing the technical environments and ensuring extremely highlevels of automation, availability, scalability and resilience.
Manage the development of the internal engineering productivity tools and environments.
Manage processes, automation, best practices, documentation.
Development and operation of continuous integration and deployment pipelines.
Monitoring automation to effectively detect/predict/prevent issues in the environment and code base.
Ability to conduct research into software issues and products as required
Working with the latest tools and techniques
Hands-on coding and mentoring, usually in a pair programming environment
Working in highly collaborative teams and building quality environments.
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure, fast paced, global environment
Knowledge in lots of different open source technologies and configurations.
What are we looking for?
Degree or Diploma in Computer Science/Engineering, Information Technology, Communications or other related disciplines.
At least three years of professional experience in a DevOps engineer or equivalent position.
Strong knowledge and experience in Devops automation, containerisation and orchestration using tools like Kubernetes, Terraform, Ansible and Docker
Strong scripting skills e.g. Python, Bash, JavaScript
Cloud computing deployment and management experience -AWS
Understand/practice Agile projects
Strong understanding of networking
Preferred:
Experience with highly scalable distributed systems
Breadth of knowledge - OS, networking, distributed computing, cloud computing
What do we offer in return?
Fun working environment
Employee Wellness Program
Does it sound like something you are interested in exploring further? Please be in touch with our team for an initial chat at chi@activate.sg
Activate Interactive Singapore is an equal opportunity employer. Employment decisions will be based on merit, qualifications and abilities. Activate Interactive Pte Ltd does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, colour, religion, gender, sexuality, national origin, age, disability, marital status or any other characteristics protected by law.
Protecting your privacy and the security of your data are longstanding top priorities for Activate Interactive Pte Ltd.
Your personal data will be processed for the purposes of managing Activate Interactive Pte Ltd’s recruitment related activities, which include setting up and conducting interviews and tests for applicants, evaluating and assessing the results, and as is otherwise needed in the recruitment and hiring processes.

Job Description:
Job Responsibilities:
Helpdesk Support(（LV1）:Provide technical support to resolve issues faced by company employees with computers, software, and hardware.
Respond quickly to and handle daily technical support requests via phone, email, or on-site assistance.
Provide training and guidance to employees on operating systems, application software, and network usage.
Hardware Architecture & Management（LV1）:Oversee the deployment, configuration, and maintenance of all IT hardware equipment (such as computers, servers, printers, scanners, etc.) within the company.
Regularly check the performance and health of hardware devices, identifying and resolving potential issues proactively.
Assist in planning and designing the company's hardware infrastructure to ensure that hardware facilities align with company needs.
Data Center Installation & Operations（LV1）:Participate in the installation, configuration, and testing of data center facilities to ensure stable equipment operation.
Monitor the data center environment (e.g., temperature, humidity, air conditioning, UPS power, etc.) to ensure the continuous and stable operation of the equipment.
Manage the daily maintenance of data center servers, storage devices, and network equipment, including hardware troubleshooting, repairs, and replacement of faulty components.
Network Maintenance & Optimization（LV1）:Responsible for the daily maintenance of the company’s internal network, including configuration and management of routers, switches, firewalls, and other network devices.
Monitor network performance and optimize the network architecture to improve network stability and security.
Configure and manage the company's VPN (if applicable) and Wi-Fi networks, ensuring smooth connectivity for remote employees and mobile devices.
Account Management & Access Control（LV2）:Responsible for creating, modifying, and deleting user accounts, and managing user permissions and access control.
Configure and maintain enterprise email systems, file sharing systems, and internal system access permissions to ensure data security and compliance.
Address technical issues related to user accounts, such as password resets, access requests, and permission issues.
Security Assurance（LV1）:Assist in implementing IT security policies to ensure the security of company data and information systems.
Perform regular system and network vulnerability scans and promptly address security vulnerabilities.
Monitor and respond to security incidents, taking appropriate measures to prevent data breaches and other security threats.
Documentation & Reporting（LV1）:Create and maintain IT-related operation manuals, troubleshooting documentation, and other technical documents.
Regularly prepare system maintenance reports, network health check reports, and other technical support records and analyses.

Job Requirements:
Education: Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.

Job Description:
The Senior Mechanical Engineer is a leadership role within EOS Defence Systems (EOS DS) and is responsible for solving problems using disciplined engineering techniques (e.g. software, mechanical, electronics, system, testing etc) to enable development of baselined and software designs that support the product development and product goals of EOS DS.

The Senior Mechanical Engineer exercises in-depth engineering technical knowledge within or across specialist disciplines and the ability to enable strategic alignment. Adherence to governance and standards and mobilising people to achieve business outcomes with the appropriate levels of integrity, safety and ethics is critical to the role.

The Senior Mechanical Engineer exercises initiative and judgement in the interpretation and application of policy and procedures. The Senior Mechanical Engineer may lead a small team and are responsible for managing, developing and guiding staff to achieve their full potential. They provide a high level of support to their team, in consultation with senior leadership, suggest staffing and workflow priorities and monitor and manage performance, health and wellbeing.

Primary Duties:
Specific Functions & Tasks
Lead and support a multi-disciplinary team to ensure the timely and professional delivery of project outcomes.
Produce mechanical designs that enable and satisfy defined requirements in the specified time frames.
Work with systems engineers to ensure that all requirements are identified, captured and analysed.
Work with project engineers to ensure design solutions are delivered on time and on budget and meet identified requirements.
Produce mechanical designs that satisfy defined requirements in the specified time frames.
Develop, review, update, modify, and approve mechanical design plans and work schedules.
Prepare and review all documentation required to support designs.
Perform conceptual design, models and drawings of complex mechanical assemblies.
Perform FEA of models.
Document designs including calculations, design options and decisions.
Conduct design reviews with the view to endorse mechanical design.
Perform test, evaluation, characterisation, verification & validation of mechanical assembles in collaboration with Test Engineers.
Prototype mechanical assemblies and systems.
Work closely with other engineering disciplines to ensure cohesive and complete system designs.
Apply DFX principles (manufacturability, testability, excellence).
Outline and assign work, review work for technical accuracy and adequacy and provide guidance and mentorship the Mechanical Engineers.
Adhere to and ensure understanding and compliance with company procedures to achieve a safe and secure work environment.
Other duties as required.
Strategy and Architecture
Contribute to and communicate strategy for emerging, new, and current technologies, products, services within Defence Systems and have authority over and accountable for the innovation and delivery practices required to assure the implementation of this strategy.
Assess and enable a high level of leadership and deep industry, defence system knowledge, and systems engineering best practice to maintain competitive advantage, exploit EOS DS technologies and minimise exposure and risk.
Communicate, advocate and influence stakeholders through effective negotiation and communication while fostering an environment of innovation, learning and continuous improvement within and outside the organisation.
Development and implementation of Engineering
Self-initiated and managed under broad direction and governance to be responsible for demonstrably leading self and others to produce designs and products that satisfy defined requirements in the specified time frames and meet group objectives.
Undertake cohesive best practice designs and analysis and develop efficient work practices to support product development activities and business outcomes.
Champion the assessment and use of rigorous development and problem-solving methods to enable safe, secure, and reliable solutions to engineering problems.
Lead and work collaboratively with engineers across functional teams to solve complex problems as a team and ensure all requirements are identified, captured, and analysed such that the design/product can be developed that satisfies the safety, quality, policy, legislative and design authority requirements.
Undertake clear and pragmatic tests, evaluation and verification activities on integrated system designs and prototypes (including formal check points) to verify and provide recommendations for sign-off of all design requirements to the lead engineer and design authorities based on relevant legislative requirements, standards and contracts.
Prepare and review all documentation required to support designs and provide tailored advice and recommendations to teams and decision makers.
Relationship and engagement
Actively listen, share knowledge and experience, provide guidance and mentorship, and work collaboratively to mobilise teams across engineering and other relevant internal and external customers to deliver engineering and business outcomes.
Work with Production Engineers and Technicians to enable and ensure the best design solutions are delivered to solve production problems and obtain business outcomes under the broad direction of the Chief Technology Officer.
Enable EOS Executive, Project Managers, and Project Engineers to ensure design solutions are delivered on time and on budget and meet other project management requirements.
Communicate insights and provide deep engineering judgement for progress and the advancement of sound engineering solutions.
Delivery and operation
Guide the design and execution of user acceptance testing and other verification activities to provide recommendations to the Chief Technology Officer, Chief Engineers and other Design Authorities.
Support production and review manufacturing and supplier requirements to meet specified timeframes, engineering standards, and business outcomes.
People and skills
Work in cross functional multidisciplinary teams to enable self and others to solve engineering problems and implement solutions

Key Attributes:
Ethical Leader.
Influencer.
Deep Technical knowledge.
Problem solver.
Engineering judgement.
Details oriented.
Works Collaboratively.
Insightful.
Communicates well.
Inventive.
Solution orientated.
Team builder.
Uses experience for sound judgements

Job Description:
Position Overview:
The Principal Electronics Engineer is a senior leadership role within EOS Defence Systems (EOS DS) and is responsible for solving problems using disciplined engineering techniques (e.g., software, mechanical, electronics, system, testing, project etc) to assure and advise on the development and/or delivery of products. The Principal Electronics Engineer possess deep technical and industry knowledge with the ability to influence and guide company direction, ensuring strategic alignment. The Principal Electronics Engineer is also responsible for developing products and designs that support the product development and product goals of EOS DS.
The Principal Electronics Engineer will lead and mentor engineers, up to and including Senior Engineers. They may provide technical assistance to multiple teams and provide a high level of support to those teams. In consultation with senior leadership, suggest staffing and workflow priorities and monitor and manage performance, health and wellbeing.
The Principal Electronics Engineer will have extensive engineering experience across the product lifecycle in a Defence environment, allowing them to provide leadership across engineering teams and execute technical authority as allocated.

Primary Duties:
Specific Functions & Tasks
Provide necessary guidance and direction to produce electronics designs and analysis that satisfy defined product development requirements in the specified time frames and exercise allocated technical authority.
Work with systems engineers to ensure all requirements are identified, captured and analysed.
Lead conceptual design and schematic capture of complex electronic circuits.
Ensure test and evaluation activities on electronics and system designs are undertaken to verify and sign-off of all design requirements.
Initiate and/or participate in planning on electronics designs.
Develop, review and champion the electronics engineering process within EOS DS.
Ensure the preparation and review of all documentation to support designs.
Perform conceptual, preliminary and detailed design of complex electronics assemblies.
Simulate analogue and digital circuits.
Document designs including calculations, design options and decisions.
Prepare for and contribute to design reviews.
Perform test, evaluation, characterisation, verification & validation of electronic subsystems in collaboration with test engineers.
Prototype electronic circuits, wiring harnesses and other systems.
Work closely with other engineering disciplines to ensure cohesive and complete electronic designs are delivered on time and on budget and meet project requirements.
Apply DFx principles (manufacturability, testability, excellence).
Review work and provide guidance and mentorship to Senior Electronics Engineers.
Engage key stakeholders and subject matter experts across technical engineering and specialty areas to understand the concept of operations and user needs to elicit and decompose electrical requirements.
Adhere to and ensure understanding and compliance with company procedures to achieve a safe and secure work environment.
Other duties as required.
Strategy and Architecture
Contribute to and influence strategy for emerging, new, and current technologies, products, services within Defence Systems and have authority over and accountable for the innovation and delivery practices required to assure the implementation of this strategy.
Assess and ensure a high level of leadership and deep industry, defence system knowledge and systems engineering best practice to maintain competitive advantage, exploit EOS DS technologies and minimise exposure and risk.
Communicate, advocate and influence persuasively through effective negotiation and communication while fostering an environment of innovation, learning and continuous improvement within and outside the organisation.

Development and implementation of Engineering
Self-initiated and managed under broad direction and governance to be responsible for demonstrably leading self and others to produce designs and products that satisfy defined requirements in the specified time frames and meet group objectives.
Undertake cohesive best practice designs and analysis and develop efficient work practices to support product development activities and business outcomes.
Lead and work collaboratively with engineers across functional teams to solve complex problems as a team and ensure all requirements are identified, captured, and analysed such that the design/product can be developed that satisfies the safety, quality, policy, legislative and design authority requirements.
Undertake clear and pragmatic tests, evaluation, and verification activities on integrated system designs and prototypes to verify and provide recommendations for sign-off of all design/product requirements to the Chief Engineer and Design Authorities based on relevant legislative requirements, standards, and contracts.
Prepare and review all documentation required to support designs and provide tailored advice and recommendations to teams and decision makers.
Relationship and engagement
Actively listen, share knowledge and experience, provide guidance and mentorship, and work collaboratively to mobilise teams across engineering and other relevant internal and external customers to deliver engineering and business outcomes.
Work with Production Engineers and Technicians to ensure the best design solutions are delivered to solve production problems and obtain business outcomes under the broad direction of the Chief Engineer.
Support the leadership alongside with the EOS Executive, Project Managers, and Project Engineers to ensure design solutions are delivered on time and on budget and meet other project management requirements.
Communicate insights and provide thorough engineering judgement for progress and the advancement of engineering solutions.
Apply interdisciplinary, collaborative approach to requirements including analysis of functional and non-functional requirements and functional performance specifications to develop effective solutions.
Delivery and operation
Guide the design and execution of user acceptance testing and other verification activities to provide recommendations to the Chief Engineer and other Design Authorities.
Support production and review manufacturing and supplier requirements to meet specified timeframes, engineering standards, and business outcomes.
People and skills
Work in cross functional multidisciplinary teams to enable self and others to solve engineering problems and implement solutions.

Ethical Leader.
Influencer.
Deep Technical knowledge.
Problem solver.
Engineering judgement.
Details oriented.
Works Collaboratively.
Insightful.
Communicates well.
Inventive.
Solution orientated.
Team builder
Uses experience for sound judgement

Job Description:
Singaporeans only
Working hours 830am to 6pm
Working days Weekdays
1 year contract (renewable basis)

● Developing and Implementing Safety Policies: Creating comprehensive safety policies
and HSSE Plant in compliance with local laws and regulations, Air Liquide safety policies
and customer safety policies.
● Risk Assessment: Developing or checking risk assessments that identify potential
hazards in the workplace. This involves inspecting equipment, workspaces, and work
practices to ensure they meet safety standards.
● Safety Training: Organizing and providing health and safety training for workers and
employees. This includes site safety orientation for workers in line with local regulation
and Air Liquide requirements .
● Accident Investigation and Reporting: Investigating workplace accidents or incidents to
identify their causes and prevent future occurrences. This also involves maintaining
records of incidents and reporting them to relevant authorities as required by
Singaporean law.
● Emergency Preparedness: Developing and implementing emergency procedures, such as
fire drills and evacuation plans. Ensuring that all employees are aware of these
procedures and that necessary emergency equipment is readily available and in good
working order.
● Health Programs: Promoting workplace health programs that may include ergonomic
assessments, wellness initiatives, and monitoring the work environment to prevent
occupational diseases.
● Liaising with External Parties: Working with regulatory authorities, and external auditors
regarding compliance issues and inspections. This may also involve coordinating with
external health and safety consultants or corporate safety representatives.
● Compliance Monitoring: Keeping up to date with changes in health and safety legislation
and standards in Singapore, ensuring that the organization remains compliant, and
advising management on necessary updates to policies and practices.

Qualifications:
● MOM Certified Workplace Safety and Health Officer
● Physically fit to work at a construction site.
● BCSS, WAH Supervisor Certificate is an advantage.
Experience:
● Minimum of 3 yrs experience working on site safety officer.
● Experience working at process/equipment construction site, plant installation, EPC, or equivalent.
Skills:
● Knowledge of Local Laws: Familiarity with Singapore’s Workplace Safety and Health Act, and other relevant legislation is essential.
● Proficient with Microsoft office application and Microsoft project or equivalent
● Proficient with Google docs, sheet, slides…etc

Job Description:
About Us:
Kangaroo Learning Center Pte Ltd (“KLC”) was incorporated on 7 May 2022. Our headquarters was established in 2014 and is a leading training institution in China, providing tuition to more than 100,000 students annually. KLC is a rapidly growing tuition centre in Singapore, dedicated to providing high-quality education in mathematics. The centre offers a range of academic and enrichment programs for students of different ages, including primary and secondary school students, as well as those preparing for the PSLE, Math Olympiad, GCE ‘O’-Level and ‘A’-Level examinations. As a young and dynamic organization in Singapore, we are committed to fostering a culture of innovation and initiative. We believe in nurturing individuals who take ownership of their roles and see themselves as co-partners in our journey towards educational excellence. Join our team and be a part of an exciting environment where you can contribute to shaping future leaders.
Job Overview:
We are seeking a passionate and dedicated Mathematics Teacher to join our team. As a Mathematics Teacher at KLC, you will play a pivotal role in inspiring students to excel in mathematics and preparing them for future academic success. The ideal candidate will be someone who takes initiative, demonstrates leadership qualities, and is eager to grow with the organization. Our goal is to groom these candidates for future leadership positions. We value a commitment to excellence and are not seeking candidates who are overly restrictive with their working hours. Join us for exciting entrepreneurial team, experience rapid growth, learning, and take on significant responsibilities.
Job Responsibilities:
Prepare and conduct math lessons that facilitate active learning experiences for students.
Foster a positive and engaging classroom culture through creative teaching methods for an enjoyable learning experience.
Manage students’ portfolio and analysis student academic evaluation.
Familiarity with PSLE, O Level, A Level, and Maths Olympiad contest papers (e.g., RIPMWC, SMOPS, NMOS, AMC8, etc.) will be an added advantage.
Engage in school branding activities, such as recording YouTube videos, writing articles, and more.
Establish rapport with both students and parents and communicate with parents on students’ academic progress regularly.
Any teaching related work as prescribed by Management.
Job Requirements:
Possesses at least Bachelor’s degree or above from an accredited university, such as NUS/NTU/SMU etc.
Fresh Graduates are welcomed!!!
No experience required, the professional training will be given.
Good interpersonal, oral and written communication skills; and the passion to co-operate with student, parents, and co-colleagues.
Able to multi-task, meticulous, with an eye for detail.
The first year S$50,000 Guaranteed Annual Salary. We top up the balance if you didn’t get S$50,000 annual salary in the first year.
Able to commit weekdays (inc. evenings) & weekends.

Job Description:
The role of the Principal Engineer is to assist the Head of MRO in planning and supervise MRO engineer. This role also needs to ensure and adherence to safety regulations, industry standards and trade compliance activities is carried out.

Primary Duties:
Reporting to Head of MRO, you will have the following key responsibilities:
Assist the MRO Head in planning and executing MRO strategies, ensuring all activities align with organizational goals.
Supervise MRO engineers, providing guidance and support to foster a high-performance culture within the team.
Coordinate and liaise with customers on any MRO related matters.
Identify areas for process improvement and implement best practices to enhance operational efficiency and reduce downtime.
Ensure adherence to safety regulations, industry standards, and organizational policies throughout MRO operations.
Assist in the development and management of the MRO budget, tracking expenditure and identifying cost-saving opportunities.
Analyze maintenance metrics and performance indicators to inform decision-making and improve reliability of equipment.
Liaise with suppliers and service providers to ensure timely availability of parts and services needed for maintenance activities.
Support the training and development of MRO staff to enhance skills and knowledge in maintenance practices.
Ensure adherence to all domestic and international trade regulations, including customs laws, export controls, and sanctions.
Perform regular audits of trade activities and transactions and prepare reports for management and regulatory bodies.
Oversee the maintenance of accurate and comprehensive records related to trade compliance activities
Key Attributes and Skills:
Strong leadership and interpersonal skills.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving Abilities.
Strong organization skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities.
Effective communication skills, both written and verbal.
Qualifications and Experience and Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Electronics, Electrical, Mechanical Engineering, or a related field.
Strong knowledge of international trade regulations, export controls, and customs compliance. (e.g. ITAR) or a related role is an advantage.
Occasional overseas travelling is required.

Job Industry: Engineering, General Work, Manufacturing, Repair and Maintenance, Precision Engineering
Job Description:
Overview:
We are seeking an experienced Senior Engineer (Facilities) to oversee and maintain our company’s infrastructure including clean room and ensure its efficient operation. The successful candidate will be responsible for the maintenance, troubleshooting, and repair of our facility's mechanical, electrical, plumbing, HVAC and security systems. You will play a crucial role in ensuring the safety, sustainability, and compliance of our physical assets.

Key Responsibilities:
Facility Maintenance: Oversee the maintenance and operation of all building systems including HVAC, electrical, plumbing, fire safety, and security systems.
Repairs and Troubleshooting: Diagnose and resolve technical issues with equipment and infrastructure to minimize downtime.
Preventive Maintenance: Develop and implement preventive maintenance plans for critical systems to ensure the reliability and longevity of equipment.
Energy Management: Optimize energy usage across the facility to improve efficiency and reduce costs.
Compliance: Ensure the facility complies with relevant regulations, health and safety standards, and environmental requirements.
Project Management: Lead facility improvement projects from design through implementation, including renovations, system upgrades, and installations.
Vendor Management: Coordinate with third-party vendors and contractors for facility, security services and repairs.
Budgeting and Cost Control: Manage facility budgets, monitor spending, and implement cost-saving measures.
Documentation: Maintain detailed records of all maintenance activities, inspections, repairs, and compliance certifications.
Qualifications:
Education: Bachelor’s degree (Diploma holder with Minimum 7 years of experience) in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Facilities Management, or a related field.
Experience: Minimum of 5+ years of experience as a Facility Engineer or in a similar role. Experience in managing Clean Room, commercial or industrial facilities is highly preferred.
Technical Skills:
Proficient in Computer Aided Design(CAD), Microsoft (excel,Words,PPT)
Extensive knowledge of HVAC, electrical, plumbing, fire protection, and security systems.
Strong troubleshooting skills in mechanical and electrical systems.
Other Skills:
Strong project management and organizational skills.
Excellent communication and leadership abilities.
Familiarity with local building codes and safety regulations.
Working Conditions:
Ability to work in various environments, including outdoor, rooftop, and Clean Room.
Occasional on-call work required for emergencies.

Job Description:
Job Duties:
· Supporting business users on application incidents/ changes requested on SW environment applications and infrastructure.
· Responsible for Yield Enhancement and Defect reduction for a specified module of the process flow across all CHD-FAB technologies.
· Involves using in-line inspection and defect review data to react to defect excursions, improve baseline defect levels, and support defect analyses for planned changes within the module.
· Determine root cause of defect issues, and drive resolution.
· Partnering with process engineering to reduce tool-level defect levels (both excursion reduction and baseline improvement).

Job Qualifications
· Bachelor’s degree or above in electrical, chemical, materials engineering.
· 8+ years of semiconductor experience in yield enhancement and/or integration preferable.
· Process and/or device engineering experience and background is a plus.
· MFG/Fab Experience: Understanding of Device Integration and Manufacturing, Statistical Data Analysis skills (SPC, DOE, etc.), Data retrieval skills (Klarity, Datalog, JMP, etc).
· Preferable Yield Enhancement Knowledge / Experience: Experience with bright field inspection tools, Experience with SEM imaging and analysis, Knowledgeable in yield enhancement data analysis (Kill Ratios, Defect contribution (adders), etc).
· Excellent communication and presentation skills across various levels of the company.
· Should be a team player and willing to work with cross functional teams in issues resolution.

Job Description:
Job Responsibilities:

1. Developing Automation Solutions:
Design, develop, and implement automation workflows using RPA tools like UiPath, Power Automate, Automation Anywhere, etc.
Build bots to automate repetitive, rule-based tasks by translating business requirements into technical solutions.
Write and test code for RPA bots and work on deploying them in production environments.
2. Collaboration with Business Analysts:
Work closely with business analysts or process owners to understand automation requirements and gather process requirements and convert it into RPA documents (PDD&SDD).
Help in identifying the processes that can be automated and optimize them for efficiency.
Ensure the automation aligns with business goals and objectives.
3. Troubleshooting and Debugging:
Identify and fix issues with RPA bots during the development and post-deployment phases.
Debug and troubleshoot errors, ensuring that automated workflows run smoothly and meet expected outcomes.
Help with monitoring bot performance to ensure the automation processes are reliable and error-free.
4. Testing and Quality Assurance:
Conduct thorough testing of automated processes to ensure they function as intended.
Verify that the bots handle edge cases and exceptions correctly.
Assist in performing unit testing, integration testing, and user acceptance testing (UAT) of RPA solutions.
5. Support and Maintenance:
Provide ongoing support for RPA bots in production, including maintenance, updates, and troubleshooting.
Assist in optimizing automation processes to improve efficiency, reduce errors, and enhance performance.
Help with the regular monitoring of deployed bots to ensure they run without interruption.
6. Documenting Work:
Create detailed technical documentation for RPA solutions, including design, workflows, and troubleshooting steps.
Maintain accurate and updated records of all RPA processes, changes, and updates.
Provide user manuals or help guides for business users interacting with RPA bots.
7. Collaboration with Senior RPA Developers:
Work under the guidance of senior developers or RPA architects to improve skills and knowledge of RPA tools and methodologies.
Participate in code reviews, providing and receiving feedback to improve coding practices.
Learn and apply best practices for RPA development, deployment, and maintenance.
8. Process Optimization:
Review existing business processes and look for opportunities to improve them through automation.
Suggest enhancements to RPA solutions to improve performance or increase functionality.
Contribute to streamlining workflows and improving the overall efficiency of automated processes.
9. Learning and Skill Development:
Continuously improve skills related to RPA technologies and development methodologies.
Stay updated with the latest trends in RPA and automation technologies.
Take part in training programs and certifications related to RPA development.
9. Adherence to Coding Standards:
Follow coding standards and best practices to ensure high-quality, maintainable code.
Work with version control systems like Git to manage and track changes in the codebase.
Requirements:
Preferred Candidates
- Development experience in RPA tools (UiPath, Power Automate, Automation Anywhere, etc.)
- RPA Certification (UiPath, Power Automate, Automation Anywhere, etc.)
- Hands on experience in Python, VB .Net, Macros
Good understanding in SDLC process
Understanding of databases and SQL
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Self-motivated in a highly demanding environment & Good Team Player
Positive work attitude & Excellent communication skills

Drive industrial relations harmony and accountability for all plant KPIs and ensures adequate training and development at all staff/operations levels

Job Description:
Job Descriptions:
Simtrum was founded in 2019 with the core mission to serve the optical industry with innovation and efficiency. Our founding team has decades of research and development experiences (across NUS and A-star) in high-end microscope systems. We now focus on confocal, super-resolution microscopy and other related fields, catering to both academia research and high end industrial production needs. Our proprietary high resolution microscopes adopt state of the art optical technology, image processing algorithms, with excellent imaging performance to meet the high resolution and fast imaging needs of our technology partners.
Simtrum is a young startup with many exciting opportunities to offer to the right candidates with the right mindset. We are now seeking the following commercial talents to join our team, to expand our reach and support our growth:
Job Descriptions:
1. Visit university professors to promote the company's microscope products and complete sales tasks.
2. Develop regional business based on existing products and assist in collecting market information for products under development.
3. Identify potential markets and establish effective market entry methods.
4. Establish marketing plans and strategies to expand your customer base.
Basic Requirements:
1.Ideally you should have a foundational education in either Electronic Engineering, Photonics, or Physics;
2.exposure to Laser or Optics industry a huge plus. Candidates with at least 1-2 years of related sales, marketing or e-Commerce experiences will be given priority considerations.
3.We are also open for fresh graduates with the right attitude and willingness to learn. To do well in the Simtrum environment, you should be someone with initiative, curious, can-do attitude, flexible, and eager to learn.

About the Strategic Communications Unit (SCU)
The Strategic Communications Unit (SCU) is responsible for creating, implementing and delivering timely, clear, concise, and effective messaging and communication strategies to enhance the corporate profile of SNEF and promulgate SNEF’s key messages across all media platforms.
The SCU produces and disseminates information, messages and publications to relevant stakeholder groups through internal and external communication and works to raise the profile of SNEF internally and externally through the development of communication and media strategies that promote the mission of SNEF.
The SCU will reside as a dedicated unit under the Policy Division helmed by the Head (Strategic Communications).
Job Description:
Collaborates with management team and comms team to develop and implement the overall communication mission of SNEF
Develops and implements a communications strategy for SNEF to build and maintains a positive corporate brand

Strategic and creative mindset
Meticulous attention to detail

Comprehensive Health Screening: Conduct health screenings tailored to corporate clients, including CEOs and top executives, ensuring thorough and accurate assessments

Emergency Screenings: Provide prompt health screenings in emergency situations as required
Streamlined Operations: Work in a structured, non-hectic environment with pre-booked appointments only—no walk-ins
Requirements
Certification: SMC-certified with a valid medical license to practice in Singapore.
Experience: Proven ability to work with corporate executives, delivering top-notch health screening services.
Residency: Open to Singapore Citizens or Permanent Residents.
What We Offer
A supportive work environment focused on quality care and professional growth
A structured schedule with manageable patient flow and no walk-ins
The opportunity to work closely with a high-profile corporate clientele

Job Description:
About SBI Singapore
State Bank of India has been playing a major role in fulfilling the global aspirations of Indian corporations through its 235 foreign offices in 29 countries across the world. Our Singapore operations were set up in 1977 with an offshore banking license, equipping us with over four decades of experience in commercial and wholesale banking.
SBI Singapore achieved its Full Bank status with QFB privileges in the year 2008. With the grant of Full Bank status with QFB privileges. SBI Singapore now has 5 retail branches, 19 SBI ATMs and over 200 ATMs via the shared island wide ATM5 network. SBI has a suite of retail banking products which complement its existing corporate banking products thus enabling us to service both individual and corporate customers. SBI Singapore is now a member of FAST payment network facilitating instantaneous SGD fund transfer among the participating member Banks.
About the Role:
Sales & Advisory
Market a range of retail banking and investment products.
Upsell and cross-sell the Bank's suite of products and services.
Offer advisory service recommending suitable wealth management products for potential customers.
Report sales activities and results to the management on a regular and prompt manner.
Competent on all KYC/CDD procedures, AML guidelines and all other regulatory guidelines governing the Sales & Advisory process.
With the cues from customer feedback, pro-actively identify opportunities and provide feedback for improvements in all areas including product & service offering, sales process or operations.
Supporting, contributing, promoting and driving technology initiatives like Internet applications, mobile applications, etc towards promoting customer convenience and service excellence
Customer Relationship Management
Take ownership to respond for all customer issues and navigate internally to address issues promptly and/or escalate to relevant authorities promptly.
To act as a single point of contact for all customers under handling.
Operational Efficiency
Be responsible for 100% accuracy on the various forms submitted to Operations or to Partners for execution.
Jointly responsible for the up keep of the branch aesthetics as per the Corporate Identity guidelines.
You will need to have:
Bachelor's Degree or equivalent; preferably in Banking, Insurance & Financial Services
Minimum of 1-2 years of experience in sales and financial products and services.
CMFAS certified required - M5, M8, M8A, M9, M9A, HI, BCP, PGI.
Excellent customer focused mindset and strong interpersonal skills.
Sound knowledge of banking, wealth management and insurance products
Strong understanding of financial compliance and regulatory requirements in Singapore.
In exchange for your input you can expect to receive:
Competitive salary with performance-based commission
Continuous learning and professional growth opportunities.
Comprehensive medical coverage
Birthday Vouchers
Employee engagement activities

Job Title: IT Security Operation Engineer / SecOps Engineer
Job Description:
Department: Regional Information Systems Division
Reports to: Regional IT General Manager
Functional Relationships with: Global Security Team, ASEAN Business Units, ASEAN local IT divisions

Successful candidate will: Be engaged and responsible for SecOps (security operations), security incident handling, SOC response, etc as a Senior Specialist, Information Security Incident Response Lead, responsible for CSIRT operations in cyber security

Key Duties & Responsibilities
• Be responsible for handling overall SecOps in cooperation with partner IT vendors and related internal departments as a member of the incident handling team within CSIRT
• Work with partner IT vendors that maintain information security infrastructure tools implemented in our company
• Monitor and continuously assess the IT security aspects and impact.
• Knowledge and strong understanding on CIS CSC to continuously improve IT security
• Reporting to Regional IT General Manager and the head of Global Security Team

Responsibilities:
While increasing cyber security risks, we must strengthen its security measures to secure our business expansion.
He/She will be able to keep updating our skill sets by touching on the latest technology trends as we continue introducing new services and technologies to achieve "Zero Trust” and “IT/OT cyber security”.
In addition, he/she can obtain a global business perspective since there are many opportunities to discuss security countermeasures with overseas members by crossing the border
1. Cyber incident response
He/She must enhance the process of incident handling and our ability to respond to incidents through the implementation of security solutions, training, and incident-handling experiences
2. Vulnerability Assessment on platform and application/implementation of countermeasures
Based on the results of various diagnostics and tools, countermeasures against vulnerabilities will be promoted together with each application engineer. We will also work with the CCoE team and PSIRT to implement measures for cloud environments, promote pre-release diagnostics, and add tools to meet operational requirements in the production environment.
3. Implementation and Maintenance of security solutions
Client is developing advanced solutions for emerging threats.
He/she must be responsible for the selection of suitable security products to fit our maintenance and operation requirements and lead PoC and implementation with well-designed operations
Ability / Competency Required
Bachelor or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or equivalent experience.
Minimum three years of experience in the Cyber Security and Infrastructure fields
Security tool implementation and operational experience/application security technology experience
CISSP - Certified Information Systems Security Professional Certifications

Job Description:
Joining Arup
Arup’s purpose, shared values and collaborative approach has set us apart for over 75 years, guiding how we shape a better world.
As an Associate, you will be Project Manager leading a team of engineers and technicians responsible for delivering projects. If you are a Singapore registered Professional Engineer, you will be assigned to be Qualified Person for the projects.
The principle activities of the role will be:
Managing the projects internally and be responsible to Project Director and Geography Leader on successful commercial outcome of the projects
Preparing and overseeing the implementation of project plans.
Leading a team of engineers and technicians in the successful delivery of projects.
Reviewing engineering design and endorse Structural Plan submissions as a Qualified Person.
Maintaining good client relationship.
The Opportunity
Lead the technical / design input on such projects, ensuring work quality is maintained at the expected standard and provide detailed design work within building structures engineering and related areas
Where appropriate, to liaise with the Business Units within the geography and more broadly across the region, providing expertise on building structures engineering as appropriate.
Extend relationships with clients to enable an expansion of business opportunities for the Building Structures Business Unit, and (where appropriate) other Business Units within the geography.
Prepare project reports for client summarizing key issues and strategically advising on best outcomes and assist in the ongoing development and maintenance of quality systems within the Singapore office.
Participate in broader Office, Geography, Regional and/or Arup Group wide activities as assigned or appropriate.
At Arup, you belong to an extraordinary collective – in which we encourage individuality to thrive. Our strength comes from how we respect, share and connect our diverse experiences, perspectives and ideas.
You will have the opportunity do socially useful work that has meaning – to Arup, to your career, to our members and to the clients and communities we serve.
Is this role right for you?
Advanced Degree or Master’s in civil engineering or equivalent with at least 10 years of relevant experience in Structural Engineering in Building projects withing a consulting environment.
Proven track record of a diverse range of projects such as in low- and high-rise building, PPVC, Pre-stressed and Timber structures and able to quickly develop successful client relationships.
Able to demonstrate strong design ability and engineering skills and knowledge
Experience in managing key projects, including the supervision of multi-disciplinary project teams where appropriate and effective technical supervision and development of less-experience team members.
Singapore Registered Professional Engineer in PEB or professional qualifications with equivalent professional institutions with excellent planning, organizational and time management skills.
What we offer you
At Arup, we care about each member’s success, so we can grow together.
Guided by our values, we provide an attractive total reward package that recognizes the contribution of each of our members to our shared success. As well as competitive, fair, and equitable pay, we offer a career in which all of our members can belong, grow and thrive – through benefits that support health and wellbeing, a wide range of learning opportunities and many possibilities to have an impact through the work they do.
We are owned in trust on behalf of our members, giving us the freedom, with personal responsibility, to set our own direction and choose work that aligns with our purpose and adds to Arup’s legacy. Our members collaborate on ambitious projects to deliver remarkable outcomes for our clients and communities. Profit Share is a key part of our reward, enabling eligible members to share in the results of our collective efforts.
Please see a list of Arup’s Singapore benefits below:
Hybrid working policy & flexible working hours
13th month bonus
Birthday leave
Paid parental leave for birth mothers 16 weeks & new parents (excluding birth mothers) 4 weeks
Purchase Additional leave of up to 20 days (permanent employees)
Paid Annual subscription to relevant Professional association.
Reimbursement of Professional Engineers application and examination Fees
International mobility opportunities
QP allowance
Site Allowance
Work related travel insurance
Dental expense cover
Marriage leave (3 days)
Examination leave (2 days)

Company: LOUIS DREYFUS COMPANY ASIA PTE. LTD.
Job Location: MARINA BAY FINANCIAL CENTRE, 12 MARINA BOULEVARD 018982
Job Description:
Overview / Brief
Louis Dreyfus Company is a leading merchant and processor of agricultural goods. Our activities span the entire value chain from farm to fork, across a broad range of business lines, we leverage our global reach and extensive asset network to serve our customers and consumers around the world. Structured as a matrix organization of six geographical regions and ten platforms, Louis Dreyfus Company is active in over 100 countries and employs approximately 18,000 people globally.

We are looking for a highly skilled Data Scientist for our global Weather Desk with a strong background in Meteorology. The ideal candidate will hold a PhD or Master’s degree in Atmospheric Science or a related field. We seek for someone who is passionate not only about data analytics and modeling, but also enjoys interpreting large-scale weather patterns and teleconnections. The role balances forecasting work for commercial teams and research projects using data science. The ideal candidate is proficient in weather forecasting and understands the driving forces behind expected weather patterns.

Diversity & Inclusion
LDC is driven by a set of shared values and high ethical standards
Diversity is part of our DNA. LDC strives to create a diverse and inclusive work environment where people can thrive regardless of gender, sexuality, ethnicity or background.

Sustainability
Sustainable value is at the heart of our purpose as a company
We are passionate about creating fair and sustainable value, both for our business and for other value chain stakeholders: our people, our business partners, the communities we touch and the environment around us.

Main Responsibilities:
Lead global weather intelligence and monitoring for the SouthEast Asia regional commercial offices
Conduct research, perform data analysis, and create predictive models using meteorological datasets
Work with internal team to expand and improve suite of weather monitoring tools and visualizations
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate complex weather/climate data into actionable insights through an agricultural commodity lens
Present weather and research output to both technical and non-technical stakeholders on a regular basis
Interact with our AI Hub in Singapore and ensure LDC benefits from the most recent developments in weather-related AI
Experiences:
At least 1-3 years of relevant experiences
Strong background in meteorology and forecasting
Proven experience in research and data analytics
Experience with agricultural commodities and trading is a plus
Experience with modeling techniques and machine learning algorithms is a plus
Experience with Google Earth Engine is a plus
Genuine interest in commodity trading industry
Strong analytical and statistical capabilities, with a proven track record in problem-solving
Excellent communication skills
Ability to work independently and in collaborative settings
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in Python
Experience in data analysis libraries (e.g. Pandas, NumPy, SciPy)
Academics:
PhD or Master’s in Atmospheric Science, Agricultural Science, Meteorology or related field of study

Job Description:
Job Summary

The Research and Development (R&D) Chef is responsible for the development and improvement of recipes and new product prototypes and processes to ensure that its processes meet the PB food quality and food safety standards. He/She provides food science expertise in designing processes to manufacture new food products on a commercial scale for marketing purposes and meeting sales and SEA region’s import and export regulations.

Job Responsibilities
Create new recipes, modifying and improving existing recipes through experimentation.
Plan, manage and run panel sessions and sensory tests on food products.
Consolidate data gathering for new product specifications.
Formulate new food production standards and standard operating procedures.
Make recommendations in the design of new manufacturing processes or to change current equipment or processes.
Modify new product recipes and ingredient selection while taking note of nutrition, shelf life, and regulations.
Establish product specifications and documentation.
Confirm product formulations and other information for constructing product profiles.
Review methods to improve the quality of new baked products and compliance with food regulations during mass production.
Develop ideas from preparation processes for marketing purposes.
Develop product improvements based on sensory testing and
data.
Facilitate innovation and lead team leaders to implement change.
Refine recipe formulation for mass production purposes.
Review ingredients to meet customer needs and requirements.
Ability to review alternative ingredients and food preparation processes to meet mass production and compliance needs.
Make recommendations for changes to new & existing food production processes.
Organise and conduct Train the trainer and on-the-job training sessions locally and within SEA regions’ production and retail kitchens.
Follow up on yearly refreshment training schedule
Troubleshoot production processes to resolve production, quality, and regulatory compliance issues.
Execute any other duties as assigned.
Skills
Possesses analytical and problem-solving skills and should be able to work independently.
Good sensory skills to evaluate flavours and create recipes for new products.
Excellent knowledge of production systems, food costing, ordering and inventory
Possess capability to lead, motivate and manage subordinates
Sound knowledge/understanding of cultural and culinary trends
Creative in developing and presenting products
HACCP certified and other food safety regulations are required
Good command of spoken English
Any additional language (eg. Korean) would be an added advantage
PC literate with knowledge in MS Office

Job Description:
Mendix – the leading low-code application development platform:
The Mendix Platform uses visual modeling to abstract long-form coding out of application development. Our customers use Mendix to create and deploy better software for the enterprise, faster. Mendix enables collaboration between business users and developers to work together throughout the development process.
Read our Customer Stories to learn more about the wealth of software and solutions global organizations have built with the Platform.
At Mendix we strive to maintain a diverse, open, and safe working environment where people can be their true selves. We value every voice, celebrate individuality, and appreciate the diversity of thought and experience. People who work here are driven, smart, and really good at what they do.
As this market evolves, we encourage people of all skill levels to work with the platform, both for clients and candidates. Apply today to discover how you can make a meaningful impact with Mendix.
Responsibilities:
Develop financially quantified Digital Transformation Programs and Project Services propositions in the context of the Mendix Low-code Platform for Customers and Prospects
Lead our clients through their digital transformation in the context of the Mendix Low-code Platform
Implement solutions to business and technology challenges and recommend creative approaches to solving clients’ business problems using Mendix methodologies.
Manage and deliver the creation of a client’s Mendix Center of Excellence; leveraging agile to drive sustainable implementation and deployment of the Mendix Low-code Platform.
Deliver baseline assessments and post-implementation analyses to evaluate, track and articulate the value realization of Customer business benefits in the context of the Mendix Low-code Platform.
Advising on how to best leverage the Mendix Low-code Platform providing architectural ‘deep dive’ workshops
Supporting Customers, as well as Channel Partners and (Global) System Integrators, in enabling them to become self-sufficient with the Mendix Low-code Platform.
Train customers and partners to bring them to the next level using Mendix way
Motivating clients with the values and principals of a Scrum/Agile led implementations with Mendix
Being hands-on, and playing an intrinsic part of the Architecture and Development process using the Mendix Low-code Platform. You will be responsible for the preparation and execution of multiple phases; through project planning, development and successful customer adoption.
Requirements:
Being Mendix Advanced or Expert Certified is a mandatory requirement
5+ Years’ software development experience encompassing front-end, back-end, cloud automation and orchestration. Strong knowledge of microservices and container technologies
4+ Years’ development experience in designing, developing, and maintaining applications using Mendix or other low code platforms or full stack development, across back-end such as Java, Python, .Net, or C++ etc
Developed frontend user interfaces using angular HTML, CSS, Sass and JavaScript frameworks such as React/Angular, jQuery
Familiarity with single-sign on processes; OAuth2 and/or CAS or SAML experience a plus
Proficient in one or more of Data design, development, and optimization of Relational database/SQL, PostgreSQL etc
Proficient in cloud native deployment with CI/CD Pipelines like [Git/SVN, GitLab CI, Jenkins, or Azure DevOps]
Working knowledge of command line based administration of Linux servers
An understanding of RESTful , SOAP APIs or middleware, Experience with web servers (Apache / NGINX / IIS)
Proficient in technical/business communication - articulating the solution design to customers
Broad-based understanding of cloud platform services, cloud-native architectures, and cloud infrastructure
Demonstrated track record of anticipating and balancing the needs of multiple stakeholders with the ability to work with senior level executives across multiple business lines and regions
Agile Enterprise Coach or Scrum certification is desirable. Experience in driving organization wide change management initiatives
Experience in driving innovation, organization wide change management initiatives.
Capable of applying knowledge of the business and the marketplace to advance the organizations goals, having foresight of possibilities, and translating them into breakthrough strategies.
Makes sense of complex, high quantity, and sometimes contradictory information, to effectively solve problems. Liaison and consultative skills: negotiating skills within a context of high political sensitivity and conflicting interests.
Adaptability and flexibility to manage deadline pressure, ambiguity, and change.
Exceptional leadership, organizational, and interpersonal skills; the ability to work well with people from different disciplines with varying degrees of technical and non-technical experience; competence in clear concise and tactful communication with senior executive management, clients, peers, and team members.
Strong writing, mentoring, decision-making, communication, and meeting facilitation skills. Ability to utilize a combination of formal authority and persuasion skill sets.

Job Description:
Responsibilities:
Conduct thorough data analysis and implement data-driven solutions to support customer issue troubleshooting, utilizing statistical modelling and machine learning techniques to identify root causes and provide actionable insights for resolution
Partner with field engineering teams to analyse data from plasma etching systems and provide timely, meaningful and accurate analysis results to support data-driven improvement
Communicate effectively with both customers and internal teams, present complex data analysis findings or results to stakeholders in a concise, effective and understandable manner
Develop advance statistical and machine learning algorithms to extract insights from large and complex data sets, and work with internal engineering team to evaluate the effectiveness of the algorithms
Collaborate with global data engineering teams to share best practices and work on cross-functional projects that require data science expertise
Manage and maintain the internal analytics solutions, supporting continuous development and implementation, and ensuring that data integrity and accuracy are always maintained
Develop and conduct training sessions for local engineers on data analytics skills such as JMP and KNIME
Other duties as assigned

Requirements:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Microelectronics, Data Science, or a related discipline.
At least 3 years of experience in the semiconductor industry, including manufacturing equipment, fabrication facilities, semiconductor components, or related fields.
Demonstrated experience as a Data Scientist within the semiconductor industry, with specific expertise in plasma dry etch processes.
Expertise in developing and deploying algorithms for process optimization and problem-solving.
Strong understanding of data analytics, statistical methodologies, machine learning techniques, and predictive modeling.
Proficient in data science tools and programming languages (e.g., Python, JSL, R) for data processing, visualization, and analysis.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively in a team setting and build positive relationships with customers.
Detail-oriented, organized, and resourceful team player.
Self-motivated and capable of working independently with minimal supervision.

Job Description:
Activate Interactive Pte Ltd (“Activate”) is a leading technology consultancy headquartered in Singapore with a presence in Malaysia and Indonesia. Our clients are empowered with quality, cost-effective, and impactful end-to-end application development, like mobile and web applications, and cloud technology that remove technology roadblocks and increase their business efficiency.
We believe in positively impacting the lives of people around us and the environment we live in through the use of technology. Hence, we are committed to providing a conducive environment for all employees to realise their full potential, who in turn have the opportunity to continuously drive innovation.
We are searching for our next team members to join our growing team.
If you love the idea of being part of a growing company with exciting prospects in mobile and web technologies that create positive impact on people’s lives, then we would love to hear from you.
Co-Development Business Unit is looking for DevSecOps Engineer
Internal Code: A24118
What will you do?
Part of the project Enterprise Information Management team to take on the exciting and challenging role of delivering and maintaining an agency-wide data warehouse and analytics project using AGILE software development methodology.
Maintain the organisation’s data warehouse and analytics platforms on both on-premise data centre as well as on cloud.
Develop automation code for testing and deployment using Azure DevOps, Git and various testing tools for the data platforms.
Liaise with both vender and inhouse team on data warehouse and analytics development platform including SQL databases, MS Sharepoint, Power BI, Tableau, Aurora PostgresSQL and Machine Learning applications on agency data centre.
Perform automated deployments to existing or new infrastructure environments
Build continuous integration and delivery pipeline for applications.
Provide production support and operation for the system during office hours or as and when required after office hours or on weekends for scheduled maintenance and deployments.
Work with the team to support existing system and integration of new components in the system.
Maintain existing infrastructure which includes Windows-based servers, SQL databases, Power BI, Sharepoint, SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), and Machine Learning Server.
Plan, design, build and maintain development environment which includes SSIS, .net, Visual basic, SSMS, etc.
Liaise with 3rd party software, hardware and application vendors to manage and resolve incidents and technical issues.
What are we looking for?
Tertiary Education in relevant fields is preferred.
Hands on experience in setting up and maintaining CI/CD platform, such as Azure DevOps, Git/Github or other related CI/CD tools.
Hands on experience in writing automation scripts for automated deployment for ETL packages, database tables, and analytics programs using R and Python.
Hands on experience in design, implementation, administration and support of data platforms such as SQL and Aurora Postgres database. Related certifications will be an advantage.
Hands on experience in setting up and maintaining a data warehouse/lake solution on the cloud and in a data centre.
Hands on experience in supporting Microsoft technologies, preferably for Business Intelligence and data management using tools such as Microsoft SQL SSIS, Power BI, R, SharePoint.
Experience in one or more of the following:
a) Building CI/CD pipeline using Azure DevOps, Bamboo, Bitbucket, Sonarqube, Fortify and Nexus
b) Building data pipelines using Python, AWS Glue, AWS Lambda, SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
c) Unix scripts for secure file transfers
d) Data security
e) Secure code review, Automated Testing
f) Big Data platform, AWS S3
g) Maintaining visualisation tools such as Power BI or Tableau, and Machine Learning applications
h) Server Virtualisation (VMWare VSphere family of products) and container technology
i) Data Virtualisation technology
j) Agile continuous integration tools
Good team player.
Passionate in championing the team to continuously improve and deliver quality software product.
What do we offer in return?
Fun working environment
Employee Wellness Program
Does it sound like something you are interested in exploring further? Please be in touch with our team for an initial chat at chi@activate.sg

Job Description:
Job Description
At Citi, we get to connect millions of people across hundreds of cities and countries every day. And we've been doing it for more than 200 years. We do this through our unparalleled global network. We provide a broad range of financial services and products to our clients – whether they be consumers, corporations, governments or institutions – to help them meet their biggest opportunities and face the world's toughest challenges.
Citibank serves as a trusted advisor to our retail, mortgage, small business and wealth management clients at every stage of their financial journey. Through Citi's Access Account, Basic Banking, Citi Priority, Citigold and Citigold Private Client, we offer an array of products, services and digital capabilities to clients across the full spectrum of consumer banking needs worldwide.
Citi Global Wealth (CGW) brings together the full power of Citi to serve the entire continuum of wealth clients, from affluent to ultra-high net worth to family offices. The strategies we create help our clients maintain liquidity while maximizing yields, transact in foreign currency and across borders, and manage fluctuating expenses or cash flow. We are uniquely suited to helping our clients meet their banking needs across regions through our global network.
We’re currently looking for a high caliber professional to join our team as Insurance Specialist - C11, based in Singapore. Being part of our team means that we’ll provide you with the resources to meet your unique needs, empower you to make healthy decision and manage your financial well-being to help plan for your future. For instance:
Citi provides access to an array of learning and development resources to help broaden and deepen your skills and knowledge as your career progresses.
Citi provides programs and services for your physical and mental well-being including access to telehealth options, health advocates, confidential counseling and more. Coverage varies by country.
The Insurance Specialist (IS) is a developing professional role. Deals with most problems independently and has some latitude to solve complex problems. Integrates in-depth specialty area knowledge with a solid understanding of industry standards and practices. Good understanding of how the team and area integrate with others in accomplishing the objectives of the subfunction/ job family. Applies analytical thinking and knowledge of data analysis tools and methodologies. Requires attention to detail when making judgments and recommendations based on the analysis of factual information. Typically deals with variable issues with potentially broader business impact. Applies professional judgment when interpreting data and results. Breaks down information in a systematic and communicable manner. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to exchange potentially complex/sensitive information. Moderate but direct impact through close contact with the businesses' core activities. Quality and timeliness of service provided will affect the effectiveness of own team and other closely related teams.

Responsibilities:
Support sales delivery to our internal and external partners through dual delivery model in follow-up and responsiveness.
Responsible for supporting internal and external growth initiatives communicated to team.
Responsible for dissemination of communications.
Provide support on increasing and capturing cross sell opportunities.
Increase efficiencies of daily sales and operational activities.
Responsible for reporting sales results and reasons for successes.
Support sales executives with specific business initiatives; create, lead and advise on sales and product training; and support growth of sales.
Liaise between sales teams and branches on initiatives.
Represent sales on the development of strategies and programs to effectively partner with the bank.
Responsible for partnering sales leadership to deliver activities, programs and promotions on monthly sales and marketing calls.
Liaise with partners to develop marketing opportunities to maximize growth in sales and customer acquisition, retention and satisfaction.
Work in coordination with sales executives in creating, driving and supporting business plans and initiatives.
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
Qualifications:
2-5 years of relevant experience
Previous banking experience preferred
Relevant Insurance (CMFAS / M papers) required
Education:
Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience

Job Description:
Job Description
At Citi, we get to connect millions of people across hundreds of cities and countries every day. And we've been doing it for more than 200 years. We do this through our unparalleled global network. We provide a broad range of financial services and products to our clients – whether they be consumers, corporations, governments or institutions – to help them meet their biggest opportunities and face the world's toughest challenges.
Citibank serves as a trusted advisor to our retail, mortgage, small business and wealth management clients at every stage of their financial journey. Through Citi's Access Account, Basic Banking, Citi Priority, Citigold and Citigold Private Client, we offer an array of products, services and digital capabilities to clients across the full spectrum of consumer banking needs worldwide.
Citi’s Treasury and Trade Solutions (TTS) provides global solutions that can help clients drive their business forward while investing in innovation to bring new solutions to life.
We’re currently looking for a high caliber professional to join our team as a Treasury Analyst (C11), Forex (FX) Advisor , based in Singapore. Being part of our team means that we’ll provide you with the resources to meet your unique needs, empower you to make healthy decision and manage your financial well-being to help plan for your future. For instance:
Citi provides access to an array of learning and development resources to help broaden and deepen your skills and knowledge as your career progresses.
Citi provides programs and services for your physical and mental well-being including access to telehealth options, health advocates, confidential counseling and more. Coverage varies by country.
The Forex (FX) Advisor is an intermediate position responsible for providing customer service assistance and meeting sales targets for financial products and services within their assigned district or location, in coordination with the broader Consumer Sales team. The overall objective is to utilize a wide range of product knowledge to build relationships with clients in order to recognize which financial products and services meet their needs.

Responsibilities:
Develop and implement sales plans to achieve all monthly and annual sales targets.
Grow and expand CPC/Citigold Treasury business with strong collaboration with CPC/Citigold Relationship Managers
Provide treasury investment recommendations, trade ideas and market updates for CPC/Citigold customers
Review, advise and execute orders for FX, FX derivatives and Premium Account.
Interact with managers and directors to ensure ongoing communication regarding existing and future client needs.
Develop and execute integrated sales and marketing strategies that are aligned to sales goals and support sales service activities including legal, corporate, and regulatory.
Ensure adherence to operational controls, including legal, corporate, and regulatory procedures, to ensure safety and security of client and bank assets.
Monitor improvement of quality of FX advisory activities, including sales targets, referral targets, strict adherence towards compliance, branch huddles.
Resolve client complaints and issues promptly and efficiently.
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
Qualifications and Requirements:Minimum of 3 years relevant experience in research, treasury investment sales or trading in fixed income, currencies, equities and other treasury related products
External certification such as CFA or MBA is an added advantage
Driven, self-motivated and able to work independently yet being a good team player, as well ability to work under pressure and manage deadlines or unexpected changes in expectations or requirements
Possesses good interpersonal and communication skills
Accreditation in CMFAS certificates – M1, M5, M6, M6A, M8 & M8A
Possesses strong interest in and understanding of economics and financial markets, particularly in fixed income, foreign exchange and equity market
Education:University degree or the equivalent in professional qualification is preferred
This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required.
